Q1.question: Does anyone in your family have a history of heart disease or stroke?

Q2.question: Have you ever had any heart problems before? Have you ever had high blood pressure or high cholesterol?

Q5.question: Are you taking any medications for your heart or blood pressure? Have you ever taken any medications for your heart or blood pressure?

drug_list.note: if yes show a list of related drugs to choose from

questions.question: Site: Where do you feel the chest pain?
Onset: When did the chest pain start?
Character: How would you describe the chest pain (e.g., sharp, squeezing, burning)?
Radiation: Does the chest pain spread to any other areas?
Associations: Are there any other symptoms associated with the chest pain (e.g., shortness of breath, sweating)?
Time course: How long does the chest pain usually last?
Exacerbating/Relieving factors: What makes the chest pain better or worse?
Site: Where do you feel the shortness of breath?
Onset: When did the shortness of breath start?
Character: How would you describe the shortness of breath (e.g., difficulty breathing, rapid breathing)?
Radiation: Does the shortness of breath spread to any other areas?
Associations: Are there any other symptoms associated with the shortness of breath (e.g., chest pain, wheezing)?
Time course: How long does the shortness of breath usually last?
Exacerbating/Relieving factors: What makes the shortness of breath better or worse?
Site: Where do you feel the chest pain?
Onset: When did the chest pain start?
Character: How would you describe the chest pain (e.g., sharp, squeezing, burning)?
Radiation: Does the chest pain spread to any other areas?
Associations: Are there any other symptoms associated with the chest pain (e.g., shortness of breath, sweating)?
Time course: How long does the chest pain usually last?
Exacerbating/Relieving factors: What makes the chest pain better or worse?

specific_questions.symptom: Pressure or squeezing in the chest

questions.question: Site: Where do you feel the pressure or squeezing in the chest?
Onset: When did the sensation start?
Character: How would you describe the sensation (e.g., tightness, heaviness)?
Radiation: Does the sensation spread to any other areas?
Associations: Are there any other symptoms associated with the sensation (e.g., shortness of breath, sweating)?
Time course: How long does the sensation usually last?
Exacerbating/Relieving factors: What makes the sensation better or worse?
Site: Where do you feel lightheaded?
Onset: When did the lightheadedness start?
Character: How would you describe the lightheadedness (e.g., feeling faint, dizzy)?
Associations: Are there any other symptoms associated with lightheadedness (e.g., nausea, blurred vision)?
Time course: How long does the lightheadedness usually last?
Exacerbating/Relieving factors: What makes the lightheadedness better or worse?
Site: Where do you feel the heartburn?
Onset: When did the heartburn start?
Character: How would you describe the heartburn (e.g., burning sensation in the chest, throat)?
Associations: Are there any other symptoms associated with heartburn (e.g., regurgitation of food, sour taste in mouth)?
Time course: How long does the heartburn usually last?
Exacerbating/Relieving factors: What makes the heartburn better or worse?
Site: Where do you experience wheezing?
Onset: When did the wheezing start?
Character: How would you describe the wheezing (e.g., high-pitched whistling sound during breathing)?
Associations: Are there any other symptoms associated with wheezing (e.g., shortness of breath, cough)?
Time course: How long does the wheezing usually last?
Exacerbating/Relieving factors: What makes the wheezing better or worse?

q1.question: Site: Where do you feel the symptoms of asthma?

q2.question: Onset: When did the asthma symptoms start?

q3.question: Character: How would you describe the asthma symptoms (e.g., difficulty breathing, chest tightness)?

q4.question: Associations: Are there any other symptoms associated with asthma (e.g., wheezing, cough)?

q5.question: Time course: How long do the asthma symptoms usually last?

q6.question: Exacerbating/Relieving factors: What makes the asthma symptoms better or worse?

q1.question: Site: Where do you feel the dizziness?

q2.question: Onset: When did the dizziness start?

q3.question: Character: How would you describe the dizziness (e.g., feeling lightheaded, spinning sensation)?

q4.question: Associations: Are there any other symptoms associated with dizziness (e.g., nausea, visual disturbances)?

q5.question: Time course: How long does the dizziness usually last?

q6.question: Exacerbating/Relieving factors: What makes the dizziness better or worse?

q2.question: Onset: When did the fainting episode happen?

q3.question: Character: How would you describe the fainting episode (e.g., sudden loss of consciousness, feeling weak)?

q4.question: Associations: Are there any other symptoms associated with fainting (e.g., dizziness, sweating)?

q5.question: Time course: How long did the fainting episode last?

q6.question: Exacerbating/Relieving factors: What do you think triggered the fainting episode?

q1.question: Site: Do you experience any discomfort while passing urine?

q2.question: Onset: When did you notice a decrease in urine output?

q3.question: Character: How would you describe the change in urine output (e.g., reduced amount, painful urination)?

q4.question: Associations: Are there any other symptoms associated with decreased urine output (e.g., lower back pain, swelling in legs)?

q5.question: Time course: How long have you noticed this change in urine output?

q6.question: Exacerbating/Relieving factors: What factors seem to affect your urine output?

questions.question: Site: Do you experience any discomfort while passing urine at night?
Onset: When did you start waking up at night to urinate?
Character: How would you describe the nocturia (e.g., frequent urination, urgency)?
Associations: Are there any other symptoms associated with nocturia (e.g., daytime fatigue, increased thirst)?
Time course: How long have you been experiencing nocturia?
Exacerbating/Relieving factors: What factors seem to worsen or alleviate nocturia?
Site: Where is the swelling located (e.g., legs, ankles, hands)?
Onset: When did you notice the swelling?
Character: How would you describe the edema (e.g., pitting, non-pitting)?
Associations: Are there any other symptoms associated with the edema (e.g., shortness of breath, weight gain)?
Time course: How long have you had the swelling?
Exacerbating/Relieving factors: What seems to worsen or alleviate the edema?
Site: Where do you feel the shortness of breath?
Onset: When did the shortness of breath start?
Character: How would you describe the shortness of breath (e.g., difficulty breathing, rapid breathing)?
Radiation: Does the shortness of breath spread to any other areas?
Associations: Are there any other symptoms associated with the shortness of breath (e.g., chest pain, wheezing)?
Time course: How long does the shortness of breath usually last?
Exacerbating/Relieving factors: What makes the shortness of breath better or worse?
Site: Where do you feel the palpitations?
Onset: When did the palpitations start?
Character: How would you describe the palpitations (e.g., skipping beats, rapid heartbeats)?
Associations: Are there any triggers for palpitations (e.g., stress, exercise)?
Time course: How long do the palpitations typically last?
Exacerbating/Relieving factors: What seems to worsen or alleviate the palpitations?
Site: Do you experience fatigue throughout your body?
Onset: When did you start feeling fatigued?
Character: How would you describe the fatigue (e.g., constant tiredness, lack of energy)?
Associations: Are there any other symptoms associated with fatigue (e.g., shortness of breath, weakness)?
Time course: How long have you been experiencing fatigue?
Exacerbating/Relieving factors: What seems to worsen or alleviate the fatigue?

specific_questions.symptom: Swelling in the hands and feet

questions.question: Site: Where is the swelling located (e.g., hands, feet)?
Onset: When did you notice the swelling?
Character: How would you describe the swelling (e.g., pitting, non-pitting)?
Associations: Are there any other symptoms associated with the swelling (e.g., shortness of breath, weight gain)?
Time course: How long have you had the swelling?
Exacerbating/Relieving factors: What seems to worsen or alleviate the swelling?
Site: How do you experience depression (e.g., feelings of sadness, hopelessness)?
Onset: When did you start feeling depressed?
Character: How would you describe your mood (e.g., low, irritable)?
Associations: Are there any triggers for your depression (e.g., specific events, changes in life)?
Time course: How long have you been experiencing depression?
Exacerbating/Relieving factors: What seems to worsen or alleviate your depression?
Site: How do you experience anxiety (e.g., feelings of worry, nervousness)?
Onset: When did you start feeling anxious?
Character: How would you describe your anxiety (e.g., constant, intermittent)?
Associations: Are there any triggers for your anxiety (e.g., specific situations, stressors)?
Time course: How long have you been experiencing anxiety?
Exacerbating/Relieving factors: What seems to worsen or alleviate your anxiety?
Site: Have you measured your blood pressure?
Onset: When did you first become aware of having high blood pressure?
Character: How would you describe your blood pressure readings (e.g., consistently high, fluctuating)?
Associations: Are there any other symptoms associated with your high blood pressure?
Time course: How long have you known about your high blood pressure?
Exacerbating/Relieving factors: What seems to affect your blood pressure readings (e.g., stress, medications)?
Site: Where do you usually experience headaches?
Onset: When did the headaches start?
Character: How would you describe the headaches (e.g., throbbing, dull, sharp)?
Radiation: Do the headaches spread to any other areas?
Associations: Are there any other symptoms associated with the headaches (e.g., nausea, visual changes)?
Time course: How long do the headaches typically last?
Exacerbating/Relieving factors: What seems to worsen or alleviate the headaches?
Site: Where is the swelling located in your legs (e.g., thighs, calves)?
Onset: When did you first notice the swelling in your legs?
Character: How would you describe the swelling (e.g., pitting, non-pitting, soft, hard)?
Radiation: Does the swelling spread to any other areas of your body?
Associations: Are there any other symptoms associated with the swelling in your legs (e.g., pain, discoloration)?
Time course: How long have you had the swelling in your legs?
Exacerbating/Relieving factors: What seems to worsen or alleviate the swelling in your legs?
Site: Where in your legs do you experience pain?
Onset: When did the leg pain start?
Character: How would you describe the leg pain (e.g., sharp, dull, cramping)?
Radiation: Does the pain spread to any other areas?
Associations: Are there any other symptoms associated with the leg pain (e.g., swelling, weakness)?
Time course: How long does the leg pain typically last?
Exacerbating/Relieving factors: What seems to worsen or alleviate the leg pain?
Site: Where in your legs do you experience pain at night?
Onset: When did the night leg pain start?
Character: How would you describe the pain (e.g., cramping, throbbing, aching)?
Radiation: Does the pain spread to any other areas?
Associations: Are there any other symptoms associated with the night leg pain (e.g., restlessness, tingling)?
Time course: How long does the night leg pain usually last?
Exacerbating/Relieving factors: What seems to worsen or alleviate the night leg pain?
Site: Which eye or eyes are affected by the vision problem?
Onset: When did you first notice the vision problem?
Character: How would you describe the vision problem (e.g., blurriness, double vision, loss of vision)?
Radiation: Does the vision problem affect other visual fields?
Associations: Are there any other symptoms associated with the vision problem (e.g., eye pain, headaches)?
Time course: How long does the vision problem usually last?
Exacerbating/Relieving factors: What seems to worsen or alleviate the vision problem?

specific_questions.symptom: Numbness or tingling in the hands or feet

questions.question: Site: Where do you experience the numbness or tingling (e.g., hands, fingers, feet, toes)?
Onset: When did the numbness or tingling start?
Character: How would you describe the sensation (e.g., pins and needles, loss of sensation)?
Radiation: Does the sensation spread to any other areas?
Associations: Are there any other symptoms associated with the numbness or tingling (e.g., weakness, difficulty gripping objects)?
Time course: How long does the numbness or tingling usually last?
Exacerbating/Relieving factors: What seems to worsen or alleviate the numbness or tingling?
Site: What specific changes have you noticed in your vision?
Onset: When did the changes in vision start?
Character: How would you describe the changes (e.g., halos around lights, flashes of light, sudden loss of vision)?
Radiation: Do the changes affect other visual fields?
Associations: Are there any other symptoms associated with the changes in vision (e.g., eye pain, floaters)?
Time course: How long do the changes in vision typically last?
Exacerbating/Relieving factors: What seems to worsen or alleviate the changes in vision?
Site: Where have you noticed the weight gain?
Onset: When did you first notice the rapid weight gain?
Character: How would you describe the weight gain (e.g., sudden, gradual, localized, generalized)?
Radiation: Does the weight gain affect other parts of your body?
Associations: Are there any other symptoms associated with the rapid weight gain (e.g., swelling, shortness of breath)?
Time course: How quickly has the weight gain occurred?
Exacerbating/Relieving factors: What seems to worsen or alleviate the rapid weight gain?
Site: Which fingernails are affected by the bluish color?
Onset: When did you first notice the blue discoloration?
Character: How would you describe the color (e.g., pale blue, dark blue, purple)?
Radiation: Is the discoloration present in other areas of your body?
Associations: Are there any other symptoms associated with the blue fingernails (e.g., cold hands, shortness of breath)?
Time course: How long have you had the blue fingernails?
Exacerbating/Relieving factors: What seems to worsen or alleviate the bluish color?
Site: Are both lips affected by the discoloration?
Onset: When did you first notice the change in lip color?
Character: How would you describe the color of your lips (e.g., pale, blue, purple)?
Radiation: Does the discoloration extend to the surrounding skin?
Associations: Are there any other symptoms associated with the lip discoloration (e.g., shortness of breath, chest pain)?
Time course: How long have you had the change in lip color?
Exacerbating/Relieving factors: What seems to worsen or alleviate the lip discoloration?
Site: Where is the abdominal pain located?
Onset: When did the abdominal pain start?
Character: How would you describe the pain (e.g., sharp, cramping, dull)?
Radiation: Does the pain spread to any other areas?
Associations: Are there any other symptoms associated with the abdominal pain (e.g., nausea, vomiting)?
Time course: How long does the abdominal pain usually last?
Exacerbating/Relieving factors: What makes the abdominal pain better or worse?
Onset: When did you first notice a loss of appetite?
Character: How would you describe the extent of appetite loss (e.g., complete loss, partial loss)?
Associations: Are there any other symptoms or factors associated with the loss of appetite (e.g., weight loss, fatigue)?
Duration: How long have you experienced the loss of appetite?
Exacerbating/Relieving factors: What seems to worsen or improve your appetite?
Onset: When did you first notice the weight gain?
Character: How would you describe the rate and pattern of weight gain (e.g., gradual, sudden)?
Associations: Are there any other symptoms or factors associated with the weight gain (e.g., swelling, changes in appetite)?
Duration: How long have you experienced the weight gain?
Exacerbating/Relieving factors: Have there been any changes in your lifestyle or diet that might be related to the weight gain?
Onset: When did you first notice the rapid heartbeat?
Character: How would you describe the sensation of your heartbeat (e.g., pounding, racing)?
Associations: Are there any other symptoms associated with the rapid heartbeat (e.g., chest pain, shortness of breath)?
Duration: How long do episodes of rapid heartbeat typically last?
Exacerbating/Relieving factors: What seems to trigger or alleviate the rapid heartbeat?
